intro: Petrophile heterophylla var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy, foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually broad and vary in shape, while the flowers are clustered in dense, rounded heads. It is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
